summary: When state and local law enforcement officers encounter people—e.g., in traffic stops—officers check their names against state database systems. The systems will return an alert if a name potentially matches one on the terrorist watchlist, which is managed by the FBI. In half of our interviews with law enforcement agencies, officials said their officers may not always know how to properly respond to these alerts...
title: Terrorist Watchlist: FBI Should Improve Outreach Efforts to Nonfederal Users
